dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, big news in the tech world this week, uh, Amazon is really turning up the heat on that JEDI contract.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, big news in the tech world this week, uh, Amazon is really turning up the heat on that J E D I contract.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon on Monday escalated its fierce opposition to Microsoft winning a lucrative government contract by calling for testimony from the president and Defense Secretary Mark Esper, according to court documents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah? I saw something about that. What's the latest?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah? I saw something about that. What's the latest?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they're escalating their fight against Microsoft winning that super lucrative government contract.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they're escalating their fight against Microsoft winning that super lucrative government contract.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon on Monday escalated its fierce opposition to Microsoft winning a lucrative government contract...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, the, like, $10 billion one, yeah?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, the, like, ten billion dollars one, yeah?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon claims it lost the $10 billion contract because Trump is personally biased against CEO Jeff Bezos for his ownership of the Washington Post, which Trump claims publishes unfair and negative coverage about him.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And get this: they're actually calling for testimony from, uh, President Trump himself. And Defense Secretary Mark Esper.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And get this: they're actually calling for testimony from, uh, President Trump himself. And Defense Secretary Mark Esper.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a filing with the U.S. Court of Federal Claims, Amazon Web Services asked a judge to allow depositions from Trump, Esper, former Defense Secretary Jim Mattis and Defense Department Chief Information Officer Dana Deasy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, the *president*? That's huge. What are they hoping to get out of that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, the president? That's huge. What are they hoping to get out of that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They're claiming they lost the contract because Trump is personally biased against Jeff Bezos, you know, for his ownership of the Washington Post.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're claiming they lost the contract because Trump is personally biased against Jeff Bezos, you know, for his ownership of the Washington Post.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon claims it lost the $10 billion contract because Trump is personally biased against CEO Jeff Bezos for his ownership of the Washington Post, which Trump claims publishes unfair and negative coverage about him.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, the whole "fake news" thing. So they think it was, like, political retaliation?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, the whole fake news thing. So they think it was, like, political retaliation?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. They're citing Trump's tweets, even one calling Bezos "Jeff Bozo," and a book where Trump apparently said he wanted to "screw Amazon out of the contract."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. They're citing Trump's tweets, even one calling Bezos Jeff Bozo, and a book where Trump apparently said he wanted to screw Amazon out of the contract.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The filing cites Trumps tweets attacking Bezos, including one calling him Jeff Bozo, and a passage from an October 2019 book by Mattiss speechwriter, who wrote that Trump said he wanted to screw Amazon out of the contract, as evidence of the presidents intent and hostility toward Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So they have, like, actual quotes. Are they asking for more than just testimony?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So they have, like, actual quotes. Are they asking for more than just testimony?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they also want court-ordered discovery. So, um, all the documents and emails relating to the contract.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they also want court-ordered discovery. So, um, all the documents and emails relating to the contract.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon is also asking for court-ordered discovery, meaning the company wants the Trump administration to hand over documents and emails relating to the contract.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oof. Trying to get to the bottom of it. I remember this whole JEDI thing was messy from the start, though.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof. Trying to get to the bottom of it. I remember this whole J E D I thing was messy from the start, though.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Even before Amazon lost, IBM and Oracle, like, complained the Pentagon was biased towards Amazon, remember?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Even before Amazon lost, I B M and Oracle, like, complained the Pentagon was biased towards Amazon, remember?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The drama surrounding the contract started even before Amazon lost. IBM and Oracle filed complaints with the Government Accountability Office alleging the Pentagon was biased toward Amazon (both claims were eventually dismissed).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, those were dismissed, weren't they?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, those were dismissed, weren't they?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: IBM and Oracle filed complaints with the Government Accountability Office alleging the Pentagon was biased toward Amazon (both claims were eventually dismissed).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep, but Trump even said he'd "look into" the bidding process back then, which, uh, worried a lot of lawmakers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep, but Trump even said he'd look into the bidding process back then, which, uh, worried a lot of lawmakers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Responding to those complaints, Trump at one point said he would look into the bidding process, stoking fears from lawmakers that the contract might be delayed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So Amazon's basically saying he *did* interfere, then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So Amazon's basically saying he did interfere, then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. An AWS spokesperson, uh, put it pretty bluntly, saying Trump uses his position to advance his personal agenda.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. An A W S spokesperson, uh, put it pretty bluntly, saying Trump uses his position to advance his personal agenda.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Trump has repeatedly demonstrated his willingness to use his position as President and Commander in Chief to interfere with government functionsincluding federal procurementsto advance his personal agenda, an AWS spokesperson said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Man, this is gonna be a massive legal battle.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Man, this is gonna be a massive legal battle.
